business.headline: Mutual funds are on the rise again. Check out these 5 bets in 2025Choosing the right mutual fund depends on how much risk you're comfortable with and how long you plan to invest.

Oyo delays IPO attempt for 3rd time as largest shareholder opposes: ReportIndia's Nifty 50 index has risen about 3% in 2025 so far, but it's still over 7% below its all-time high from October last year. This market volatility has affected several companies.

UPI witnesses small dip in April, but yearly growth remains strongAccording to data from the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), UPI processed 17.89 billion transactions in April, which is about 2.2% less than March's 18.30 billion.

Adani's nephew accused of insider trading by Sebi, seeks settlement: ReportThe scrutiny is the latest challenge for the Adani group. US authorities last year indicted Gautam Adani and two Adani Green executives for allegedly paying bribes to secure Indian power supply contracts and misleading US investors. The group has denied the charges and called them "baseless".
Sensex ends 260 points higher, Nifty above 24,300; Adani Ports gains 4%The S&P BSE Sensex rose 259.75 points to close at 80,501.99, while the NSE Nifty50 ended just 12.50 points higher at 24,346.70.
Zoho halts $700 million chip manufacturing plan. Here's whyZoho, started in 1996, is known for offering affordable business software and services to companies around the world.

Vizhinjam port inaugurated: What makes it a strategic gem for IndiaThe Vizhinjam port has a natural sea depth of around 20 metres, making it suitable for very large ships without the need for deep digging, which is common in other ports.

UPI payments to get faster from June 16: What it means for youNPCI shared in its latest circular stated that from June 16, 2025, UPI users can expect quicker responses when checking the status of a transaction or reversing a payment.

Rupee at strongest since October 2024 as it breaks 84/dollar markThis marks a nearly 2% weekly gain for the rupee, powered by a sustained rally in Indian equities and growing optimism over an early US-India trade deal under the Trump administration.

Zomato shares rise despite 78% drop in Q4 profit. Should you buy, hold or sell?Eternal posted revenue of Rs 5,830 crore, broadly in line with analyst estimates. EBITDA margin slipped to 1.2%—falling short of expectations—but the company managed to maintain stable contribution margins in both food delivery and quick commerce.
Adani Group stocks rise up to 5%. Here's whyAdani Enterprises' shares climbed more than 2% on Friday after the company reported an increase in its net profit for the January–March quarter.
Sensex gains 900 points. 3 reasons why stock market is rising todayThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 867.48 points at 81,109.72 around 10 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 247.90 points to trade at 24,582.10.

entertainment.headline: Salman Khan's films go wrong as he tries to accommodate friends: Shehzad KhanVeteran actor Shehzad Khan calls out criticism against Salman Khan, highlighting his generosity, loyalty, and enduring mass appeal. He shared the screen with the superstar in 'Andaz Apna Apna', which was recently re-released in theatres.

Virat Kohli calls Nee Singam Dhan his favourite song, actor Simbu reactsDuring a recent chat show, cricketing superstar Virat Kohli revealed that his favourite song right now was AR Rahman's 'Nee Singham Dhan' from the Tamil film 'Pathu Thala' starring Silambarasan TR aka Simbu.

Kiara Advani to walk the MET Gala 2025 red carpet wearing Gaurav GuptaSoon-to-be mother Kiara Advani is set to make her Met Gala debut in 2025 in a custom Gaurav Gupta outfit. She will be joined by Shah Rukh Khan, Diljit Dosanjh, and Priyanka Chopra, marking a grand moment for Indian stars on the global fashion stage.

Alia Bhatt to join Aishwarya Rai, Eva Longoria for Cannes red carpet debutAlia Bhatt is set to make her Cannes Film Festival debut. She will join the roster of Loreal global ambassadors, including Aishwarya Rai and Eva Longoria among others.

After Paresh Rawal, Anu Aggarwal claims she drank her urine: It's amritActor Anu Aggarwal came out in support of veteran actor Paresh Rawal's claims about the health benefits of drinking one's own urine. During a recent event, she revealed that she had also tried it herself and claimed that there were anti-aging effects on her skin.
Anil Kapoor's mother Nirmal dies at 90Actor Anil Kapoor's mother Nirmal Kapoor died on May 2. She was 90 years old.

MET Gala 2025: Priyanka Chopra will make fifth appearance in Balmain and BulgariPriyanka Chopra Jonas is set to return to the MET Gala 2025 for the fifth time. She will join a star-studded lineup as the event celebrates the legacy of Black style with the theme 'Superfine: Tailoring Black Style.'

Lost In Starlight: South Korea's bet to turn global spotlight on their animation'Lost in Starlight' is marking a significant leap in the South Korean entertainment industry by being Netflix's first Korean animated film. With the global reach, will the spotlight now turn on South Korean animation?

Veteran actor Mumtaz, SRK's first crush, says no to playing his mother in filmsVeteran actor Mumtaz said she won't play Shah Rukh Khan's mother in films, as she wants roles that match her age and looks. She appreciated SRK's praise but added that she chooses roles that fit her style and image.

Fawad Khan, Atif Aslam's Instagram blocked in India after Hania Aamir, MahiraPakistani artistes Fawad Khan and Atif Aslam's Instagram accounts have been blocked in India after Hania Aamir and Mahira Khan. This comes after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir.

Akshay Kumar, Saif to reunite for edge-of-the-seat thriller after 17 years: ReportActors Akshay Kumar and Saif Ali Khan are set to reunite on screen after 17 years. The two shared screen space in 'Tashan' (2008).

Mika says Salman is different person after 2 drinks, recalls him ignoring Meet BrosMika Singh talked about Salman Khan's mood swings, the person he becomes after '2 drinks', and how he ignored Meet Bros. During an event after having dinner with them the night before.

When Steven Spielberg met Kareena at a restaurant: You are that girl from 3 IdiotsKareena Kapoor recalled at WAVES 2025 that Steven Spielberg once recognised her as the "3 Idiots girl" and praised the film. She also expressed that she is open to international projects.

Complaint against Vijay Deverakonda for comparing Pahalgam to tribal clashesA complaint has been filed against actor Vijay Deverakonda for his remarks against the tribal communities. This came after the actor condemned the Pahalgam attack.

Actor Jeremy Renner rejects Hawkeye Season 2: They offered me half the moneyActor Jeremy Renner rejected the 'Hawkeye' Season 2 proposal offered by Disney due to salary issues. He hinted that Disney offered him a lower salary because of the life-threatening snow-plow accident he suffered back in 2023.

Solo Leveling Season 3 on cards? Crunchyroll President 'hopes so'Solo Leveling, which has become the most-watched anime on Crunchyroll in the first quarter of 2025, will get a third season soon. Crunchyroll President Rahul Purini said that the team of the anime are trying to find the right time to get started on the next season.

Malayalam actor Vishnu Prasad dies of liver diseaseMalayalam film and television actor Vishnu Prasad has passed away at the age of 49 in Kochi. He was undergoing treatment for liver-related issues and was awaiting a transplant.

Kull review: This game of thrones between siblings is dark and grittyReleased-Fri May 02, 2025Kull review: 'Kull-The Legacy Of Raisingghs', starring Amol Parashar, Nimrat Kaur and Ridhi Dogra, is now streaming on JioHotstar. The eight-episode drama explores how far a royal family will go when power is the ultimate prize. Read our review here.

general news.headline: Dream becoming reality: PM Modi calls Amaravati foundation of Andhra's aspirationsPrime Minister Modi calls Amaravati the key to fulfilling Andhra Pradesh's dreams of modern development, with the city's progress set to transform the state into a hub for future technologies and growth.

Trump announces revoking Harvard's tax-exempt status: 'It's what they deserve'US President Donald Trump announced the revocation of Harvard University's tax-exempt status after the university refused to comply with his administration's demands for governance, policy, and campus activism reforms.

When terrorists hijacked ODI in Srinagar, attacked Kapil's DevilsSrinagar was making its international cricket debut with an India-West Indies ODI in the Sher-e-Kashmir Stadium. It was October 1983, and India, led by Kapil Dev, had recently won the World Cup. The Pakistan-backed terrorists chanted anti-India slogans, dug up the pitch during the break, and attacked Kapil's Devils with stones and bottles. The match became more than a footnote in the chapter on terrorism in Kashmir.

Adani port in Communist state triggers 3-cornered credit fightAs PM Narendra Modi inaugurated the Vizhinjam Seaport in Kerala, the BJP, Congress and CPI(M) rushed in to claim credit for India's first deepwater transshipment project. The Adani-built project is poised to transform CPM-ruled Kerala's economy, and bolster India's position on the global trade map.
Humble makhana gets a fancy makeover in Indian homes this summerMakhana glow-up is real. Summer 2025 is all about using makhanas at home for dishes like smoothies, mousse desserts and puddings.

Pawan Kalyan does a Modi, switches to English on Pahalgam: PM has assured...With his switch from Telugu to English, Pawan Kalyan ensured that his message on the Pahalgam terror attack reached the people of Andhra and beyond.

Prince Harry loses fight against UK removing his police protection in BritainThe ruling brings an end to Prince Harry's prolonged legal battle, during which he argued that he remains at high security risk due to his royal status and past military service, particularly from threats posed by terrorist organisations.

7.4 magnitude quake hits Drake Passage; Chile, Argentina issue tsunami warningThe epicentre of the quake was 219 kilometres off the coast of the Argentine city of Ushuaia at around 2 pm (local time), the USGS said, while also reporting aftershocks.

Mika says Salman is different person after 2 drinks, recalls him ignoring Meet BrosMika Singh talked about Salman Khan's mood swings, the person he becomes after '2 drinks', and how he ignored Meet Bros. During an event after having dinner with them the night before.

Right to be heard: Court notice to Sonia Gandhi, Rahul in National Herald caseDelhi's Rouse Avenue Court on Thursday issued a notice to former Congress Chairperson Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi, and other proposed accused to be heard on the question of cognisance of the chargesheet filed against them in the National Herald case.

US straddling the fence amid India-Pakistan tensions post Pahalgam attack?While the US has been loud and clear in its support for India and its fight against terrorism, Donald Trump and top officials have spoken in differing voices on the Pahalgam attack.

Many will lose sleep: PM Modi's jibe at INDIA bloc ft. Shashi TharoorAt the Vizhinjam port inauguration in Kerala, Prime Minister Narendra Modi used Congress MP Shashi Tharoor's presence to take a political dig at the Opposition's INDIA bloc, stirring fresh speculation.

Alia Bhatt to join Aishwarya Rai, Eva Longoria for Cannes red carpet debutAlia Bhatt is set to make her Cannes Film Festival debut. She will join the roster of Loreal global ambassadors, including Aishwarya Rai and Eva Longoria among others.

Amaravati revived: All you need to know about Andhra Pradesh's capital in makingAfter years of uncertainty, development of Andhra Pradesh's capital Amaravati is back on track. Revived by Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu's 2024 return to power and fresh funding, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will relaunch the construction work.

Is it Jaishankar? Congress on Himanta Sarma's 'MP's children not citizens' claimChief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma's claim that the minor children of a sitting MP from Assam are "no longer citizens of India" has triggered a sharp counterattack from the Congress.

German spy agency brands far-right AfD as 'extremist', opens way for closer vigilA 1,100-page report by experts found that the AfD is a racist and anti-Muslim organisation, a finding that grants the security services powers to recruit informants and intercept party communications.

Kareena Kapoor at WAVES Summit: Don't need to work in Hollywood to get noticedWAVES Summit 2025 live: The event is currently being held in Mumbai. Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the first-of-its-kind four-day summit at Jio World Convention Centre on May 1. Kareena Kapoor Khan and Vijay Deverakonda discuss cinema and more with Karan Johar during a session. Follow the event live here.

BJP stole Rahul's thunder with caste census. But there are other advantages tooUnion Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw's casual announcement at the end of a Cabinet briefing that the upcoming census would include an enumeration of different castes across the country took the Opposition completely off guard.

Why did it rain so heavily in Delhi-NCR? Weather department explainsThe India Meteorological Department (IMD) explained that this sudden weather change was due to a combination of factors involving moisture and wind patterns.
Anil Kapoor's mother Nirmal dies at 90Actor Anil Kapoor's mother Nirmal Kapoor died on May 2. She was 90 years old.

Bengaluru CEO says he raised Rs 120 crore but was still 'broke, worried about rent'Harsh Pokharna, co-founder and CEO of digital ledger app OkCredit, shared a post on LinkedIn in which he wrote about the personal struggles faced by startup founders.

Don't think it's a secret: Bilawal Bhutto on Pakistan's links with terror groupsBilawal Bhutto's remarks came during an interview with Sky News, where he responded to a question regarding earlier comments by Pakistan's Defence Minister Khwaja Asif on the country's link to terror groups.

Adani's nephew accused of insider trading by Sebi, seeks settlement: ReportThe scrutiny is the latest challenge for the Adani group. US authorities last year indicted Gautam Adani and two Adani Green executives for allegedly paying bribes to secure Indian power supply contracts and misleading US investors. The group has denied the charges and called them "baseless".

Trump, divine dreams and his miraculous 38 virginsOn National Prayer Day, US President Donald Trump sought "divine dreams" and discussed bringing "religion back to the White House". Then, he addressed Muslims and thanked them for voting for him in the 2024 Presidential election, and discussed a conversation with Imams of Michigan, involving "38 virgins".

sports.headline: Jos Buttler becomes first England batter to complete 4000 runs in IPLJos Buttler has become the first England batter to complete 4,000 runs in the Indian Premier League (IPL), reaching this landmark in Match 51 of the IPL 2025 season against Sunrisers Hyderabad in Ahmedabad.

ECB bars transgender players from women's cricket with immediate effectThe England and Wales Cricket Board banned transgender players from participating in women's and girls' matches. This announcement comes less than 24 hours after the English Football Association also took a similar decision.

Virat Kohli clarifies after liking actress's photo on Instagram: Had no intentIndian star Virat Kohli issued a clarification on Instagram after he 'liked' a picture of actress Avneet Kaur posted on a fan page.

Gujarat Titans hand Gerald Coetzee debut vs SRHGujarat Titans introduced South African pacer Gerald Coetzee in their match against SunRisers Hyderabad. The strategic change aims to leverage Coetzee's pace on a conducive pitch.

PSG confirm Ousmane Dembele hamstring injury ahead of crucial Arsenal clashOusmane Dembele's hamstring injury has sparked concerns for PSG ahead of their semi-final second leg against Arsenal, with no clear return date yet revealed as Luis Enrique's side prepare for a decisive Champions League battle in Paris on May 8.

Rohit Sharma gifts bat to RR's Shane Bond's son, sends hilarious messageRohit Sharma's post-match gesture stole the spotlight as he gifted a signed bat to Shane Bond for his son, along with a cheeky message, after leading MI to a thumping win that ended RR's playoff hopes in IPL 2025.

Babar Azam, Rizwan's Instagram accounts blocked in IndiaBabar Azam, Mohammad Rizwan and Instagram accounts of Pakistani cricketers have been blocked in India after 26 people died in the Pahalgam attack on April 22.

Watch: MS Dhoni fangirl ecstatic after CSK captain gives her autographed jerseyIPL 2025: A fangirl of MS Dhoni was over the moon after the Chennai Super Kings' skipper gave her an autographed jersey. CSK have already been eliminated from the competition.

Sudharsan knows English conditions, should be picked for Test tour: ShastriFormer Indian cricketer Ravi Shastri backed Sai Sudharsan to make the squad for the England Test series given his familiarity with the playing conditions on English soil.

Sudharsan knows English conditions, should be picked for Test tour: ShastriFormer Indian cricketer Ravi Shastri backed Sai Sudharsan to make the squad for the England Test series given his familiarity with the playing conditions on English soil.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
